document.title: COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH AND PHYSICAL EDUCATION Grades Pre-Kindergarten to 12

B5A7313DBB4D4533B33E16655C0F421A.description:
Propose and support classroom policies and behaviors that promote dignity and respect.
[HPE; SE]

3EC7E73DDFCA4826BB86FAA2F3AE7CCA.description:
Demonstrate ways to treat people – including other students, their family members, and
members of the school community – with dignity, respect, and empathy without regard
to race, color, sex, gender identity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability,
or personal characteristics such as body shape or weight. [HPE; SE]

B864DE30C1A64E6996BE4F378F2BD4F1.description:
Use accurate information when discussing environmental health issues (e.g., littering,
deforestation, recycling, climate change, clean water) that impact people’s health. [HE]

E7B119AB203348509720ABFF01B9C168.description: Describe the ways that rules and laws can affect community health and health disparities. [HE]

9BE3493ED4F44C39BF7362AB0D40114C.description: Describe ways that the community can impact the health of people within that community. [HE]

3E34CF51BF7943CE87BB8F8D42E73727.description: Analyze issues of health inequities and injustices locally, nationally, and internationally. [HE]

A922D3C537B3427EA4616F5CF81938FF.description:
Discuss that people may experience health disparities and health inequities (unfair and
avoidable differences in health) due to factors such as socioeconomic status, disability, race,
ethnicity, and access to resources. [HPE]

0A895E5A52134BF1B41972BDE1F8A511.description: Analyze the relationship between personal health and the health of the community. [HPE]

FADA9D6DA5BA4AD6BADF25A095ABA44D.description:
Self-Advocacy and Health Promotion.
Promote personal, family, and community health and well-being.

EA82B65D72F749F99A948A906AECAFF8.description:
Locate trusted adults (including parents/guardians) from whom to get help if
boundaries are being violated or one is being physically, emotionally, or sexually
harassed or assaulted. [HE]

3060CCFE24284E0CB2A6C1A0B0A761AB.description:
Identify parents, guardians, or other trusted adults (e.g., counselors and other health care
professionals) whom students can ask questions about puberty and adolescent health issues
(including abuse and neglect). [HE]

B64ABBC650D640A8AD3F015BE447E762.description:
Explain the relationship between sexual intercourse and human reproduction, the range of ways
pregnancy can occur, and valid and reliable resources for information or support related to
these topics. [HE]

BE3AA3D9BCCB45779B176029CBF9536E.description: Explain how gender identity and sexual orientation can vary in each individual. [HE]

8A297B4499924F5B9CAD1A574C3E390B.description:
Use valid, reliable, and medically accurate resources (e.g., school nurse, doctor, digital
resources, health teacher, community organizations) to find information about the human
reproductive systems, human sexual development, and the effects of hormones (e.g., romantic
and sexual feelings, mood swings). [HE]

F9A3195AF1CB49AD8120349B47F59F95.description:
Locate resources from home, school, and community that provide medically accurate
sources of information about human sexual and reproductive anatomy, puberty, and
personal hygiene. [HE]

82D5BE4FD2E54356BF8C800212AB6325.description:
Identify characteristics of valid health information, products, and services related to
human sexual and reproductive anatomy, puberty, and personal hygiene. [HE]

A92B3BAA55734EAAAFCB1988EEFAA1C9.description:
Information and Resource Seeking. Access, evaluate, and use valid and reliable health information, products, services, and
related resources.

93F30588FF364532942CF314210EB544.description:
Demonstrate how media, including social media, and technology can influence mental and
emotional well-being (e.g., stress levels, happiness, mood). [HE; SE]

A93294F5859D4EEEB38F72F0747D35F7.description:
Describe how peers, media, family, society, community, and culture can influence ideas about
body image, and the impact on self-esteem and behaviors. [HE; SE]

28AFA74270C5420DB1FA8C8ED73262B3.description:
Describe supports needed to achieve success for a difficult activity or task in varied
contexts. [HPE; SE]

610AC9E993E34E35829BC01939FEF9CE.description:
Identify personal strengths and opportunities for growth and improvement in a variety of
contexts (including physical activity). [HPE; SE]

B55406B3049D41548E61F44168A30479.description:
Describe personal interests and the skills needed to pursue those interests in ways that support
personal growth. [HPE; SE]

4C7B7B262AD1468AAC2D84398D5E1027.description:
Describe personal and cultural identities and assets, their importance and value, and explain
how they support mental and emotional health. [HE; SE]

19DFE26A18CB4246BCBE70D73576E538.description:
Self-awareness and Analyzing Influences.
Examine how emotions, thoughts, needs, values, beliefs, and other factors (both internal
and external) influence behaviors and articulate how these influences impact health
behavior and outcomes.

C2F714FC8A3C4AAA9F5C6CFD0BD7169D.description:
Demonstrate developmentally-appropriate manipulative skills with hands in a variety of
situations and tasks (i.e., catching/fielding, sending and receiving an object, obtaining
possession of game object, striking a ball with short- and long-handled implement, kicking,
rolling a ball, volleying, and serving, dribbling, throwing and catching) in a variety of
environments. [PE]

071E72E215CF42099E3D2F1CF311EBC5.description:
Demonstrate the ability to combine locomotor skills, stability/non-locomotor skills (e.g.,
bending, twisting, rising, falling) movement concepts (e.g., levels, shapes, extensions, pathways,
force, time, flow) and/or balance and weight transfer techniques to create and perform a
gymnastic sequence, a jump rope routine, a dance with a group or other cultural and creative
activities independently, with a partner or in a group. [PE]

78D93AEEDE8E4B49B6780A5B00D32121.description:
Demonstrate the ability to combine locomotor (including jumping and landing patterns) and
manipulative skills (e.g., striking, dribbling) in a variety of small-sided practice tasks/games (e.g.,
for execution to a target, to demonstrate control). [PE]

004C7137AEF44B4D8A75F3F69C2C7F91.description:
Demonstrate developmentally-appropriate balancing on different body parts, rolling actions,
and weight transfer actions in a dynamic environment. [PE]

7A9FA79998344F99837CB5500A080933.description:
Demonstrate ability to perform various locomotor skills combined with movement concepts
(e.g., moving at different levels, pathways, directions) during dynamic small-sided games and
other athletic and physical activities. [PE]

CC66D592BF3B4B5B85FAF92C0803310E.description:
Demonstrate developmentally-appropriate patterns of varied locomotor skills, jumping and
landing, and step-like actions in a dynamic environment. [PE]

9D1E6F99909D4EDB9A0F6B84527FD43E.description:
Movement Skills.
Demonstrate competence in, and knowledge of, a variety of movement forms, motor
skills, physical fitness components, and principles in order to engage in purposeful and
health-promoting physical activity, including sports and games.

5472A1B87FCE40B88C83330F50C96243.description:
Demonstrate effective refusal of alcohol, nicotine, electronic vapor products, marijuana,
inhalants, and other substances that can negatively impact health. [HE]

631C88598D6A42238F56CC90259AF2D4.description:
Effectively communicate personal feelings or perspectives about substance use and misuse.
[HE]

52A6A83A727A41EBAB220E0A41E18FBE.description:
Analyze data related to use of nicotine, alcohol or other legal drugs that are prohibited for
minors. [HE]

94DFAA080F07450A894D991650E751A1.description:
Identify possible reasons (e.g., media, peer pressure, stress, culture) why individuals might
use legal and illegal drugs and discuss health-promoting strategies to avoid illegal drug use
and prevent unsafe or potentially harmful use of legal drugs. [HE]

172FB37D792541DCBEC0BC0F56A0382C.description:
Distinguish between the use and misuse of legal (e.g., prescription medications prescribed to
you, over-the-counter drugs, and (at a certain age) nicotine, electronic vapor products,
alcohol, and marijuana) and illegal drugs (e.g., prescription medicines not prescribed to you,
cocaine, alcohol and nicotine use before legal age), and identify potential effects of each on
the body. [HE]

4A6F73B155A44C3F81DFD963EBCDC7FC.description:
Describe the benefits of movement and being physically active, especially with others, on
physical, social, and emotional health. [HPE]

A399EB0485F242EBA2C67F982CE00245.description: Identify opportunities and safe places for physical activity outside of school. [HPE]

9F1A18B8641345BA9BE0251AE204D292.description:
Demonstrate strategies for collaborating, working and playing safely and effectively with
others, including perspective taking, in physical education and other physical activity settings.
[PE; SE]

D707DD781359410F8F7B67DC44AD6669.description:
Effectively manage emotions (e.g., anger, frustration, excitement) in a manner respectful to
self and others during physical education and in other physical activity settings. [PE; SE]

CD4857B57D61482D856229BECDC1A065.description:
Identify and describe social benefits gained from participating in physical activity and sports
(e.g., making friends, being on a team, building trust). [HPE]

268587AC2D3F439795900327AA5352F4.description:
Uses communication skills to negotiate roles and responsibilities and to provide peer
feedback in a physical activity setting. [PE; SE]

ABDE788648E04DFC944B65EC7A810C1B.description: Respectfully accepts and implements feedback from the teacher when prompted. [PE; SE]

A71901B61F3B46A5A25FB11926764F7E.description:
Accept, recognize, and actively involve others with both higher and lower skill abilities into
physical activities, in and outside of physical education, and group projects. [PE; SE]

6DF6CDDF638E4A1EAA4CF51AB85FA960.description: Describes why following game rules are important in a physical activity setting. [PE]

302DC3B4A826437BA3E626BD7CA304CF.description:
Recognizes the role of respectful interactions with others when participating in physical
activity. [PE; SE]

12597FF166C24F8F88AB522BE0DBB9B8.description:
Identify signs and symptoms of mental distress in self and others, and how to get help for self
or others. [HE; SE]

86404EA1767044F395AED3FB6F61E7C3.description:
Demonstrate how to discuss mental health and mental health conditions in culturally
responsive ways and in ways that reduce stigma. [HE; SE]

35CF18720ACB4A869D4337900B5CFE42.description:
Demonstrate how to ask for assistance with mental health questions, issues or concerns (e.g.,
challenges with friends, feeling anxious). [HE; SE]

46185A389D144B95937A7C2FF15A966D.description:
Explain the importance of talking with friends, parents, guardians or other trusted adults
about feelings and emotions. [HPE; SE]

6AB5B17574944FE49D445DF36D593C2C.description:
Develop an awareness that emotions may be expressed in different ways (e.g., through body
language, intensity of expression) by various groups and in different cultures. [HPE; SE]

FC7EBE3E3FC24F92BA2B4C592ECA35D9.description:
Describe ways that stereotypes, perceived stereotypes, prejudice, discrimination, inequality
and injustice can impact relationships, and demonstrate strategies to address these factors.
[HPE; SE]

3DAE7CFC018544019F7397B5819B1275.description:
Describe a range of ways people may express their gender and that some people’s gender
identity (how they think about themselves) matches others’ expectations about what their
bodies look like on the outside and others do not. [HPE; SE]

938BA520059043938E286DB6B27BBABC.description:
Describe the differences between assigned sex at birth and gender identity and explain how
one’s outward appearance and behavior does not define one’s gender identity or sexual
orientation. [HE; SE]

8205792A4A2845F689E41E9C3CF68D07.description:
Describe how personal experiences, peers, family, media, society, community, and culture
influence ways people interact in relationships and social situations. [HPE; SE]

349F7B178B3A419F908B68715C9BD55A.description: Identify and practice conflict prevention, management and resolution strategies. [HPE; SE]

388155E309B14E829CD64BC2D5732A66.description: Identify and practice non-violent communication skills. [HPE, SE]

09B6608044C44B47A88573B112664C51.description: Identify and respond to bullying situations in a variety of settings. [HPE; SE]

8AA78F3DEF094EC5B382DC03D2B0A942.description:
Differentiate between conflict and bullying and articulate the importance of the difference to
avoid escalating conflicts into bullying or violence. [HE; SE]

18733602407A4409B55FA11933BC7577.description:
Demonstrate strategies for addressing one’s own feelings and the feelings and perspectives of
others in order to support positive relationships. [HPE; SE]

3D2DAD0D3881424BBB728E115154CEB1.description:
Define and demonstrate ways to determine and respect the boundaries of self and others.
[HPE; SE]

8EEB52964295414F8E2FDE6185DC1EEA.description:
Identify characteristics of healthy and unhealthy relationships with a variety of individuals
(i.e., family, peers, trusted adults, teachers). [HE; SE]

29EC94690BC84AB3BEDC1957A161460B.description:
Social Awareness, Relationship, and Communication
Skills.
Enhance relationships, personal health, and the health of others through social
awareness and effective communication.

05000538E58E4C64B9F16D89DA70C1E9.description:
Identify different physical activities, in physical education class and outside of school, for
personal enjoyment and challenge, independently and with others. [PE]

82758350F4884A60B882139460101979.description:
Recognizes and articulates how physical activity influences physiological changes in their body.
[PE]

785F0FE7158047DF8DCED5CC2D0EA725.description:
Design a simple fitness goal and plan that includes warm-up and cool-down activities, uses
physical activity to enhance personal fitness, and includes resources to assist in achieving the
goal. [PE]

8F7C4F390C6D4F84A614FAE716C883AD.description:
Describe health benefits of regularly participating in physical activity on multiple dimensions of
wellness (e.g., cardiovascular health, fitness levels, muscle strengthening, stress management,
supporting positive mental health). [HPE]

187BE23811434D12B0E069744476CC2A.description: Defines and explains how to implement principles of exercise. [PE]

61AE09272FDA447E85D5999068AE272F.description:
Defines and provides examples of movement activities for developing the health-related fitness
components and for developing skill-related fitness components. [PE]

3401A9D034244770B96129AA1F4CBD02.description:
Demonstrate respect for self and responsible, safe interpersonal behavior (i.e., peer to peer,
student to teacher) that contributes to positive social interaction in a variety of physical activity
contexts. [PE; SE]

23481B36CD8645D6AEE18A26CEA86207.description:
Demonstrate the use of assertive behavior, refusal skills, and actions intended for personal
safety. [HPE; SE]

D40E0F497C03435AB1DEFC1C7EAF1315.description:
Distinguish among safe, unsafe, and inappropriate touch and demonstrate strategies for getting
help including how to tell a trusted adult if this happens. [HE]

44EE14F217DC43DDA4970AC561775B8E.description:
Demonstrate the ability to set and maintain developmentally-appropriate boundaries (including
physical, verbal, sexual, and emotional boundaries) and how to respond if those boundaries are
violated. [HPE]

3691CD1B0949468B9D12FB44ABC33278.description:
Define and provide examples of behaviors that would be considered child abuse and neglect
(including physical, emotional, and sexual abuse), and describe actions and behaviors to take if
feeling threatened by either someone known or not known. [HE]

D3F105FC49F940FFB8C49F6EDBBA9D42.description:
Apply strategies to be and stay safe when using the Internet, and other digital technology,
and social media, including addressing and preventing media overuse. [HE]

0906E41E197D4D188368EA381014B81E.description:
Identify and demonstrate how to contact appropriate resources when someone is poisoned
or injured and needs help (i.e., calling poison control and 9-1-1). [HPE]

3F6E94687CD64053AAF0E6C65776E495.description: Explain safety precautions for playing outdoors in different kinds of weather. [HPE]

1422C0B29A5F4BD49AB001405EE04230.description:
Recognize aspects of the environment (e.g., whether or not crosswalks are clearly marked,
presence of sidewalks, access to healthy foods, access to green space, levels of violence in
a community) that can positively or negatively impact safety. [HPE]

5C41ED3212A248E79A643DE348003342.description:
Describe ways to promote personal safety and reduce the risk of unintentional injuries in a
variety of situations (e.g., at home, at school, during physical activity, around motor
vehicles, around firearms, around water, fire prevention, during a fire, as a
pedestrian). [HPE]

B3F52B86C1804D979F44687ED907B474.description:
Set a goal related to personal health (e.g., tooth brushing, sleep, hydration, ergonomics, sun
safety, limiting screen time, hearing protection, physical activity, wearing protective
equipment), identify resources to assist in achieving it, and track progress toward its
achievement. [HPE; SE]

66C7BA424CDC4D67B81A592A9B7D9499.description:
Discuss influences on and barriers to maintaining or enhancing physical health and hygiene.
[HPE]

209FB2D3F4C741B2B1AE5F631EB8F574.description:
Describe personal behaviors and strategies that promote health and/or avoid health risks (e.g.,
pedestrian safety, sun safety, protecting oneself from infectious diseases, adequate sleep, good
nutrition, ergonomics, protective equipment, appropriate amounts of screen time, hearing
protection, being physically active). [HPE]

7E98477FC38A4C2BAAF6438A7407AFC5.description:
Describe health-promoting behaviors during menstruation, including ways to maintain personal
hygiene, cope with emotional changes, manage pain and identify when help or support is
needed. [HE]

C2C02506DDE2436DB3A8EA5465359DAE.description:
Explain a variety of health-promoting practices to manage the social, physical, and emotional
changes associated with puberty and into adolescence. [HPE]

F4AD648641F64688839855C060D5FBD6.description: Recognize and respect that all bodies are different. [HPE]

92B293D5CA00433894698F45BE4C2DFF.description:
Describe the physical, social, and emotional changes that occur during puberty and adolescence,
how the timing of puberty and adolescent development varies considerably, and the role of
puberty in overall development. [HE]

B3D77D940B504CA3B5D3574095A7FF8D.description: Demonstrate strategies that support a growth mindset in and out of school. [HPE; SE]

B28A622208EB485DB8A41BFCF31D55CA.description: Identify strategies for planning, prioritizing, and managing time. [HE; SE]

5EFA1EEADE03490395892DEDB8CA8497.description:
Demonstrate strategies and behaviors (which may include getting help) to help meet personal
responsibilities and identify strategies to overcome barriers to meeting personal responsibilities.
[HPE; SE]

41E3F35BE7AE4B3FAFAC56BC406131B4.description:
Identify personal stressors and demonstrate effective stress management techniques, alone or
with support. [HPE; SE]

D9ACCD15324446029289017B0C27D57B.description:
Apply self-monitoring strategies, alone or with support, to regulate emotions (e.g., breathing
techniques, appropriate sleep, proper nutrition) in varied settings. [HPE; SE]

CC129B82DDAF43E3B797FBC97C92C0EA.description:
Set a goal to use one or more health-promoting practices or behaviors (e.g., being aware of your
own feelings and the feelings of others, safe online behaviors, engaging in physical activity,
limiting screen time) and track progress towards its achievement in order to maintain or
improve mental and emotional well-being. [HPE; SE]

1B2AB531E07E4461BC3BA62476D02381.description:
Identify characteristics of and practices to support mental and emotional well-being within
various cultures and diverse perspectives. [HE; SE]

61201ED4E5F54C49890655FE6260D6CC.description: Describe and demonstrate strategies for expressing and regulating emotions in healthpromoting ways. [HPE; SE]

56724C6CF1F4415DB091860EF2ABEBA7.description: Identify how a person’s brain and body influence mental and emotional well-being. [HPE; SE]

086EE940B701432F9FB66BC4F3CA0325.description:
Recognize that all feelings and emotions are information that individuals can use to support
mental and emotional health. [HPE; SE]

A2A78603B0974BA48CE34E13F582287F.description: Discuss how feelings and emotions can impact behavior. [HPE; SE]

F775713A4C0F46538BCD6E3D44851B6A.description:
Identify different feelings and emotions (e.g., anger, fear, grief, sadness, anxiety, stress,
hopelessness, gratitude, love, excitement, contentedness, hope, pride, happiness) that people
may experience and how people might express those emotions (including individual and cultural
differences in expression). [HPE; SE]

466C1AB0BDAC48FA8513A3C5E1D0B872.description:
Self-management and Goal Setting.
Set goals, engage in health-promoting behaviors, and avoid risky behaviors.

C6EBEA29DF0245CB82970231E12FC25B.description:
Compare benefits of various physical activities in order to support personal decision-making
related to physical activity. [PE]

C97598549747404E90A3CFB60E3B31A3.description:
Engage in independent and cooperative problem-solving activities while participating in physical
activities. [PE; SE]

E698243F515341F2910298213B05CB3A.description:
Demonstrate effective decision-making skills while engaged in emerging and maturing skill
performance settings (including dance and gymnastics), games, and activities. [PE]

24F0179BEABB4098BB977ECB18CEBD69.description:
Adjust performance of locomotor, manipulative, and stability skills based on environmental and
task constraints and ensure safe physical activity participation of the individual and peers. [PE]

775117DB4B9348C5B054C1D7E0CB1C91.description:
Analyze and modify a movement based on the demands of the task and/or environmental
constraints in dynamic and changing situations. [PE]

49372A0C40B3452ABFFCAAF1415EC999.description:
Apply movement concepts, principles and strategies to avoid objects within dynamic
environments [PE].

E298A2C6BDEA4110941A68A943092894.description: Apply basic offensive and defensive strategies and tactics in a variety of activities and smallsided games. [PE]

901DCE55FED44F0EBBE27C4F2EBA5BD2.description:
Analyze movement situations and apply the appropriate spatial, movement, and strategic
concepts (e.g., force, direction, speed, pathways, extensions) in small-sided practice tasks, game
environments, dance, and gymnastics. [PE]

8ED34B8A050C46CCA1B6A1A593E7099C.description:
List options, predict potential outcomes of decision options, make a health-promoting choice,
and analyze the outcome of decisions in common nutrition situations. [HE]

EDD2AD4D931A46DCBA5E403566AC025A.description: Recognize that individuals have different food related needs, preferences, and traditions. [HE]

082E1C193FF74016ADF5B0B4E1925FF6.description:
Explain a variety of factors that can influence decisions about nutrition (e.g., food during
celebrations, food preferences, media advertising, celebrity endorsements and product
placement, access and availability, financial resources, physical activity levels). [HPE]

D527E1E532E74107940508771E82B6F7.description:
Identify circumstances (e.g., budget, food access and availability, time management) that help
or hinder decisions about nutrition and determine when assistance is needed in order to make a
health-promoting decision. [HPE]

90A8C43431FB4B36AEB8F7F6F1D07AEB.description:
Describe how cultivation, trade routes, and regions affect food supply, and how food production
affects nutrition-related decisions. [HE]

F0343E7EDBCE413A8CF4D9AE01EDD0C1.description: Demonstrate how to use food labels as part of nutrition-related decision-making. [HE]

5A32D05E1B4941EA8F8D079491C19B1D.description:
Discuss the benefits of balanced eating on physical health (e.g., supporting growth and
development, ability to engage in physical activity), social health, and emotional and mental
health (e.g., ability to manage stress, positive emotions) when making nutrition-related
decisions. [HPE]

AC79F40A2CEB4C98BF70F9D773D275B5.description:
Identify and describe hunger and satiety cues and how these can inform nutrition-related
decision-making. [HE]

6404A619246242E295B327F844CC8E0C.description:
Identify principles of balanced eating to meet nutritional needs (e.g., moderation, eating a
variety of fruits and vegetables, consuming nutrient-rich foods, limiting processed foods and
foods high in added sugar, drinking water, limiting sugary beverages) when making nutritionrelated decisions. [HPE]

A1ED843CE65545A6ABA2D934BB7F57A4.description:
Decision-making and Problem-Solving.
Make health-promoting, informed, responsible decisions and solve problems in a variety
of health-related situations.
